name: Open Foris (OF) Collect and Collect Mobile
description: Free open-source solutions for environmental monitoring
SDGevidence:
FAO has a long history in supporting countries on national forest monitoring and has developed a suite of open source tools under the Open Foris initiative (http://www.openforis.org/). By January 2021, total of 25 countries have used OF Collect in their National Forest Inventory (NFI) for collecting field data. 
OF Collect has been used in Chad for woodfuel assessment in areas surrounding to the refugee camps (http://www.fao.org/3/ca0817en/CA0817EN.pdf) , and OF Collect Mobile has been used to gather transaction data and thus to ensure food supply in rural Bangladesh (https://scalingupnutrition.org/news/digital-technology-ensures-food-supply-in-rural-bangladesh-during-covid-19/).  In addition, OF tools are used for example for socio-economic inventory in Mongolia and dairy industry survey in Kazakhstan (http://www.eastagri.org/docs/group/390/collect%20mobile%20in%20Kazakhstan.pdf) .
 Of the 50 countries that have submitted a FREL/FRL submission to the UNFCCC, 56% has used OF Collect to collect and manage data from their forest inventory. 
( http://2019ar.unredd.net/knowledge-management-results/forest-monitoring-systems-and-measurement-reporting-and-verification/ ).
More about OF tools in this article: https://medium.com/@open.foris/open-foris-fao-in-collaboration-with-google-developing-innovative-technical-solutions-for-8062f6f4a945
